result.execSummary:
The defendant Joshua M. Smith was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 813.12(8)(a).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
*Huber priviliges for work, counseling or any other reason the sheriff will allow
*2nd half of the sentence to be served on GPS electronic home monitor, if he qualifies

miscConds.notes:
*Pay fine plus costs
*If probation is discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Per Wisconsin Statute, funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 50% of gross.

*Participate in any counseling or assessments as deemed appropriate by the agent.
*Comply with conditions of the Injunction in 15CV350
*No abusive contact with victim, C.A.M.
*Provide DNA sample

Defendant Joshua M. Smith in court with attorney Ryan Drengler. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Cases heard today are 16CF35 and 16CF262.

9:28 a.m.    Atty Knaapen calls the case and states the appearances.

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
16CF35:
Count 1 - No contest (does not meet the requirements of the domestic abuse assessments)
Count 2 - No contest (does not meet the requirements of the domestic abuse assessments)
Count 3 - DRI

16CF262:
Count 1 - No contest 
Count 2 - DRI
Count 3 - DRI
Count 4 - No contest 
Count 5 - DRI
Count 6 - DRI

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty on Count 1 & 2 of 16CF35 and Count 3 is DRI of 16CF35 and guilty on Count 1 & 4 of 16CF262 and Counts 2, 3, 5 & 6 are DRI of 16CF262.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.

Atty Knaapen makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
State has complied with victim notification; victim does not appear in Court today.
Atty Drengler makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Defendant makes a statement prior to sentencing.

BY THE COURT:
16CF35:
Count 1 -
Impose/Stay 120 day jail sentence - huber priviliges for work, counseling or any other reason the sheriff will allow and 
2nd half of the sentence to be served on GPS eletronic home monitor if he qualifies 
Placed on Probation for 24 months -
**Conditions of Probation:
Obtain and maintain full-time employment.
Participate in any counseling or assessments as deemed appropriate by the agent.
Comply with the conditions of the Injunction in 15CV350
No abusive contact with victim, C.A.M.
Pay $250 fine plus costs
Pay DNA surcharge
Provide DNA Sample

Count 2 -
Impose/Stay 150 day jail sentence - concurrent with Count 1, huber priviliges for work, counseling or any other reason the sheriff will allow and 
2nd half of the sentence to be served on GPS eletronic home monitor if he qualifies 
Placed on Probation for 24 months -
**Conditions of Probation:
Pay costs
Pay DNA Surcharge
Comply with conditions as stated in Count 1

Count 3 - DRI

16CF262:
Count 1 -
Pay fine of $100 plus costs
Pay DNA Surcharge
Provide DNA sample 
Pay within 60 days or you will need to set up a payment plan today with the Clerk of Court's Office.

Count 2 - DRI
Count 3 - DRI

Count 4 -
Impose/Stay 150 day jail sentence - concurrent with Count 1 of 16CF35, huber priviliges for work, counseling or any other reason the sheriff will allow and 
2nd half of the sentence to be served on GPS eletronic home monitor if he qualifies 
4 days jail credit
Placed on Probation for 24 months -
**Conditions of Probation:
Pay costs
Pay DNA Surcharge
Comply with conditions as stated in Count 1 of 16CF35

Count 5 - DRI
Count 6 - DRI
